00034 // Note on time units (stay focused, this is crazy)
00035 //
00036 // There are several time units in SON files:
00037 //
00038 //   * time base units (>= version 6, fixed value of 1.0e-6 in earlier versions)
00039 //   * clock ticks
00040 //   * channel sampling intervals
00041 //
00042 // The time base is given by timeBase (defined in the file header) and is typically one microsecond (1.0e-6).
00043 // The number of time base units per clock tick is given by usPerTime (also defined in the file header):
00044 //
00045 //        clock tick duration (in s) = timeBase * usPerTime               (>= version 6)
00046 //    or  clock tick duration (in s) = 1.0e-6 * usPerTime                 (< version 6)
00047 //
00048 // For instance, if timeBase = 1.0e-6 and usPerTime = 2, then a clock tick lasts 2 Âµs. Finally, the channel
00049 // sampling intervals vary with the kind of channel. For an ADC channel it is given by:
00050 //
00051 //       sampling interval (in ticks) = lChanDvd                (>= version 6)
00052 //   or  sampling interval (in ticks) = divide * timePerADC     (< version 6)
00053 //
00054 // (lChanDvd and divide are defined in the channel info, and timePerADC is defined in the file header).
00055 // As a consequence:
00056 //
00057 //       sampling interval (in s) = lChanDvd * usPerTime * timeBase                (>= version 6)
00058 //   or  sampling interval (in s) = divide * timePerADC * usPerTime * 1.0e-6       (< version 6)
00059 
00063 class SONFile : public ifstream
00064 {
00065         public:
00071                 SONFile(string filename);
00075                 virtual ~SONFile();
00079                 virtual void open() throw(SONError);
00083                 virtual void init() throw(SONError);
00089                 virtual inline void readBlockHeaders(uint16_t channel);
00094                 virtual inline string getName() const;
00099                 virtual inline uint16_t getNChannels() const;
00104                 virtual inline const int16_t getVersion() const;
00109                 virtual inline const SONFileHeader *getFileHeader() const;
00115                 virtual inline const SONChannelInfo *getChannelInfo(uint16_t channel) const;
00121                 virtual inline const SONBlockHeaders *getBlockHeaders(uint16_t channel) const;
00127                 virtual inline double getSamplingFrequency(uint16_t channel) const;
00132                 virtual inline double getSecondsPerTick() const;
00138                 virtual inline uint16_t getTicksPerSI(uint16_t channel) const;
00144                 virtual inline uint32_t getNBlocks(uint16_t channel) const;
00151                 virtual inline uint16_t getNSamplesInBlock(uint16_t channel,uint32_t block) const;
00157                 virtual inline int64_t getNSamples(uint16_t channel) const;
00163                 virtual inline uint16_t getNSamplesPerWaveform(uint16_t channel) const;
00169                 virtual inline int64_t getFirstBlockOffset(uint16_t channel) const;
00176                 virtual inline int64_t getBlockOffset(uint16_t channel,uint32_t block) const;
00182                 virtual inline bool isADCChannel(uint16_t channel) const;
00188                 virtual inline bool isADCMarkChannel(uint16_t channel) const;
00194                 virtual inline bool isEventChannel(uint16_t channel) const;
00200                 virtual inline bool isSimpleEventChannel(uint16_t channel) const;
00206                 virtual inline bool isMarkerChannel(uint16_t channel) const;
00212                 virtual inline bool isTextMarkChannel(uint16_t channel) const;
00213 
00214         private:
00215 
00216                 string                                  filename;
00217                 SONFileHeader                   *fileHeader;
00218                 SONChannelInfo                  *channelInfo;
00219                 SONBlockHeaders         *blockHeaders;
00220                 uint16_t                                        nADCChannels;
00221                 uint16_t                                        ADCChannels[1000];
00222                 uint16_t                                        nADCMarkChannels;
00223                 uint16_t                                        ADCMarkChannels[1000];
00224                 uint16_t                                        nEventChannels;
00225                 uint16_t                                        eventChannels[1000];

00228 string SONFile::getName() const
00229 {
00230         return filename;

00234 {
00235         return fileHeader;

00238 const int16_t SONFile::getVersion() const
00239 {
00240         return fileHeader->getSystemID();
00241 }

00244 {
00245         return &channelInfo[channel];
00246 }

00255         return fileHeader->getNChannels();
00256 }

00258 uint16_t SONFile::getNSamplesPerWaveform(uint16_t channel) const
00259 {
00260         return channelInfo[channel].getNSamplesPerWaveform();

00263 // See note on time units at the beginning of this file
00264 double SONFile::getSamplingFrequency(uint16_t channel) const
00265 {
00266         return 1.0L/(getSecondsPerTick()*getTicksPerSI(channel));
00267 }
00268 
00269 // See note on time units at the beginning of this file
00270 double SONFile::getSecondsPerTick() const
00271 {
00272         return fileHeader->getSecondsPerTick();
00273 }
00274 
00275 // See note on time units at the beginning of this file
00276 uint16_t SONFile::getTicksPerSI(uint16_t channel) const
00277 {
00278         if ( fileHeader->getSystemID() < 6 )
00279         {
00280                 return channelInfo[channel].getDivide() * fileHeader->getTimePerADC();
00281         }
00282         else
00283         {
00284                 return channelInfo[channel].getLChanDvd();
00285         }
00286 }
00287

00289 {
00290         return channelInfo[channel].getNBlocks();
00291 }

00294 {
00295         return blockHeaders[channel].getNSamplesInBlock(block);
00296 }

00343 void SONFile::readBlockHeaders(uint16_t channel)
00344 {
00345         blockHeaders[channel].read();
